text: Warsaw Metro is a metro system in Poland. Its first line (M1) was opened in 1995, with another section being added in 2008. It has 21 stations. The next two stations are being planned. In 2015, a second line (M2) was opened. There are 27 stations in the second line. The system has 39 stations. As of 2025 it is the only metro system in Poland. Category:Rail transport in Poland Category:Warsaw Category:Rapid transit systems
title: Warsaw Metro
